div1.head: Newspaper clipping, April 11, 1905
div1.p:

Lazear died

WARDS OF THE ISOLATION YELLOW
FEVER HOSPITAL, COLUMBIA BARRACKS,
HAVANA, CUBA.

As the Medium of Spread-
ing Fever Epidemic
Showing the Insect to be the

Secretary Rabbitts then read a com-
munication from the Men's club of the
Congregational church, inviting the co-
operation of the Literary club in form-
ing a Civic league for this city. After
a thorough discussion however it was
decided in view of the fact that the club
was purely a literary one, it was not in
line to take sides in any municipal af-
fairs, and the invitation was respect-
fully declined.

The essayist for the evening was Dr.
A. H. Vance who read a paper on “Dr.
Walter Reed and the Mosquito.”

The effort was a clear and concise
statement of the discovery made by Dr.
Reed in which he found that the spread
of yellow fever is due to the bite of the
mosquito, and was an excellent effort
both from a literary standpoint and the
sentiments contained. Dr. Vance spoke

“The female, who, bear in mind, does
all the biting, is distinguished from the
male, when examined under the micro-
scope, by the fact that she has a lower
jaw which is absent in the male.

“Now if a stegomyia bites a person
having yellow fever in the first three
days, and no later, of the disease, and
the blood extracted is digested for a
period of 12 days, and no shorter, and
then bites a person non-immune to the
disease, the person bitten is stricken
with yellow fever five days afterward,
and in no other way can the disease be
contracted.

“The discovery of this fact is what
has given us almost absolute control of
yellow fever and will cause Walter
